CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Bethea, steelworker, 7301 Race Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I would say politics.  They do follow church leadership, but not as much as politics.  And the reason they are guided by politics is because they are looking forward to such personal gains like jobs, police protection, neighborhood improvements, and the like."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Bethea wearing light colored zippered jacket with dark collar and eyeglasses, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs store in background, Downtown
